para.text: A person shall pay a fee as set forth in Regulation .02 of this chapter by check or money order.
The Board shall provide a copy of this chapter:
Along with any application form or renewal form; and
To any other person on request.
The Board shall refund the initial licensure or renewal fee, less a $50 processing fee, to a dentist or a dental hygienist who does not qualify for initial licensure or renewal.

section.heading: Fee Schedule.
section.text: The following fees are established by the Board:

para.text: Credentials processing (foreign dental school graduate surcharge) . . . $75;
Temporary license application fee — dental hygienist . . . $75;
Application fee for dentists licensed in another state . . . $450;
Application fee for dental hygienists licensed in another state . . . $275;
Dentist late renewal fee (July 1 through July 31 of the year in which the renewal is due) . . . $300;
Dental hygienist late renewal fee (July 1 through July 31 of the year in which the renewal is due) . . . $150;
For the renewal period ending March 1, 2017, a one-time 1-year certificate for dental radiation technologists whose certificates end in an even number . . . $34;
For the period March 2, 2017 through April 1, 2017, for the 2017 renewal period, a late renewal fee for dental radiation technologists whose certificates end in an even number . . . $25;
On and after April 2, 2017, for the 2017 renewal period, a certification reinstatement fee for dental radiation technologists whose certificates end in an even number . . . $59;
For the period March 2, 2018 through April 1, 2018, for the 2018 renewal period, a late renewal fee for dental radiation technologists whose certificates end in an even number . . . $25;
On and after April 2, 2018, for the 2018 renewal period, a certification reinstatement fee for dental radiation technologists whose certificates end in an even number . . . $59;
Late renewal fee (March 2 through April 1 of the year in which the renewal is due) . . . $50;
Initial application fee for applicants holding an active license or certification to practice dental radiation technology in another state . . . $20;
Lost, destroyed, or duplicate license fee . . . $15;
Advanced clinical training continuing education program application fee for a dentist who does not hold a Maryland license . . . $25;
Class I and Class II permit fees:
Additional location for a like permit — further evaluation not necessary . . . $500;
Additional location for a like permit — further evaluation necessary . . . $700;
Renewal of additional location for a like permit . . . $300;
Additional location for a like permit — further evaluation not necessary . . . $600;
Additional location for a like permit — further evaluation necessary . . . $700;
Renewal of additional location for a like permit . . . $600;
Conversion of parenteral sedation administration permit to a Class II permit . . . $300;
Conversion of a general anesthesia administration permit to a Class III permit . . . $600;
Class III dental school facility permit fee:
Certificate fee for a treating dentist to allow another dentist or physician to administer anesthesia and sedation at the site of the treating dentist:
Certificate fee for a treating dentist to treat a patient at a practice location other than their own, at which anesthesia and sedation is administered to the patient:

Single fee for dental hygienist recognition as qualified to administer local anesthesia, or qualified to administer nitrous oxide, or qualified to prescribe and administer medication, or any combination thereof . . . $50;
Certificate fee for a treating dentist to allow a certified registered nurse anesthetist to administer anesthesia and sedation at a specific practice location:
Board fee for full permit to dispense prescription drugs . . . $75;
Required Division of Drug Control inspection fee for full permit to dispense prescription drugs . . . $1,000;
Limited permit for dispensing prescription drugs:
Late fee for failure to notify the Board within 60 days of change of address . . . $10;
Dentists — diskettes, labels, rosters, or tapes . . . $190;
Dental hygienists — diskettes, labels, rosters, or tapes . . . $130;
Dental assistants — diskettes, labels, rosters, or tapes . . . $145;
Copy of Maryland Laws and Regulations on computer disc or booklet . . . $25.
